body_html:
@tanzhenyu
Thanks for your reply

model itself is only aware of weights that are managed by layers

if so, then Model.get_weights is NOT consistent with Model.weights and Model.save_weights which contain the extra variables

import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.python.ops.resource_variable_ops import ResourceVariable


class Model(tf.keras.Model):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.v = ResourceVariable([1.])

m = Model()
# not empty
print(m.weights)

m.save_weights("save/model")
reader = tf.train.NewCheckpointReader("save/model")
# m.v is also in this list
print(reader.get_variable_to_shape_map().keys())

body:
@tanzhenyu 
Thanks for your reply
> model itself is only aware of weights that are managed by layers

if so,  then `Model.get_weights` is NOT consistent with `Model.weights` and `Model.save_weights` which contain the extra variables
```
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.python.ops.resource_variable_ops import ResourceVariable


class Model(tf.keras.Model):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.v = ResourceVariable([1.])

m = Model()
# not empty
print(m.weights)

m.save_weights("save/model")
reader = tf.train.NewCheckpointReader("save/model")
# m.v is also in this list
print(reader.get_variable_to_shape_map().keys())
```
